channel.title: Fundamentals on HoneyTrap
channel.description: Recent content in Fundamentals on HoneyTrap

item.title: Quick Start
item.description:
In this quick start, we’ll start a HoneyTrap server with the help of Docker. We will start a Docker container with an image of Honeytrap, automatically downloaded from the docker hub. The config file we’ll use for this quick start is described in the Basic config section. We’ll concentrate on implementing only one service, a ssh-simulator with only one channel, the console.
This tutorial is made for Linux.

item.title: Internal Concepts
item.description: All the concepts introduced in this documentation are described in the following sections.

item.title: HoneyTrap Configuration
item.description: In the following sections, you can find all the configurations available for your HoneyTrap.
